评论详情: I just retired just a after nearly a year of casual use, and my review is 99% positive. They're very comfortable, well-constructed (the soles started wearing down a couple months ago, but the uppers still look new- no tears and all the seams are as tight as the day I got them). The price is right, too- for $43, I definitely got my money's worth, and it's a great way to see if barefoot shoes are for you. This was my first pair of barefoot shoes, but adjusting to them from fat-heeled, cushy Hokas was surprisingly painless. If you plan on actually running in them, probably stick to offroad- The soles are flexible and very thin, with no cushioning: you'll definitely feel it if you pound the pavement or step on a rock. That's my only complaint, and it applies to barefoot shoes in general, not just these.  I've since purchased a couple other brands of barefoot/zero drop shoes, and where these Whitins really shine are the fit and style. Barefoot shoes should move with your feet, which these do very well- the sloes flex effortlessly and the uppers have just the right balance of padding and rigidity to lock on to my heels and stay comfortably in place through my stride. Even with thin socks, they never chaffed. I tried a different, more expensive Amazon-exclusive brand of barefoot trainers and my heel would lift nearly half-way out of them when I walked.  If you're comparison shopping, you've probably noticed that this type of shoe has a wide toe box, which tends to give them an unflattering "clown shoe" vibe (seller's pictures tend to show their product at only flattering angles, but if you look at user review photos, you'll see it). The model I bought-WHITIN Men's Barefoot Running Shoes | Minimalist Cross-Trainer| - is just as wide as the others, but the wrap-around soles and the placement/shape of those plastic side panels gives them a *much * slimmer appearance.  I couldn't be happier with my purchase and will definitely be getting another pair soon!

I was weary due to seeing some negative reviews, but, I love them! Great price and good quality. They are extremely comfortable and they fit perfectly. They definitely give plenty of room for your toes but don’t look boxy. They look really nice on and slip on and off super quickly and easily.

评论概述: European Style and Size - Quality above average - durability too early to tell
评论详情: Many inaccurate statements in other reviews (mostly the negative ones), so setting the record straight and providing an honest review. The hard part, of course, is that everyone has different opinions on shoes, the hardest thing to get a prevailing/standard opinion on.  The incorrect stuff - there is no tongue; yes there is, it's just affixed all the way up the opening like a hunting boot - it has hard plastic shoelace inlets; no it doesn't, it's a soft fabric backed material a little stiffer than the main upper material - there is no padding in the foot; yes there is, but it is thinner than a tennis shoe, more than a leather dress shoe (higher quality ones). It doesn't have memory foam/gel, etc. like many tennis shoes do now. -they are narrow; this is a lot subjective in the reviews, no measurements, but IMHO, they are not wide, and not really advertised like that as I saw it a few days ago. They 'feel' a little tight/different, mostly because the middle section/eyelet material is stiffer than the main shoe material which is very soft and I assume breathable. This could create a 'ridge' you'd feel if laced tight. I generally get 'hot spots' around my ankles in hunting boots, this doesn't feel like that and once broken in (if they do break in) it shouldn't be noticeable. -no heel retention; I list this as a pro below, it actually cups my heel very well, better than most tennis shoes (what wears out first besides the sole) and dress shoes until they're broken in  Pros -price - got these on Prime day for $35 which if they last (just received today) is a good deal -main material - it is very soft, shouldn't create any rubbing but for the above perceptions for some, and durability is a question, we'll see -sole - I cannot see why this would be more slippery than any other 'tennis shoe' like bottom, if they get dirty or other slippery substance on them, they may be slippery - never had a pair that wasn't in that situation - heel portion, as above cups very nice and grabs and doesn't slip like most new shoes do at first (or all the time and wear out - at least for me)  Cons -you can feel the sole through the cushion - is subjective, my BMI is harder so I feel more in my feet as far as uneven -medium width, not wide; I have wider feet, but I've had shoes too wide too - these are not 'tight' but feel a bit snug, but are also brand new, not sure how much they will 'break in'. -sizing - my feet measure 12 1/2, that's the option I picked, the sticker as you can see says 46 which is European Men's, Google AI says both a 46 is a 12 and a 45 is a 12 1/2, go figure. For me, if I stand up, my toe almost touches standing still, meaning it will rub. I put on my well broken retired tennis shoes and the distance is the same and do not hurt at all, so I assume these will be fine.  I considered sending back because they do not feel 'soft and smooth all over' like some tennis shoes do ($100 Nike/etc.), but they are intended minimalist and some talk about benefits for plantar (it's not planter folks, that's for plants or peanuts :-),) fasciitis, which I have, so I'm going to keep and try them out. All the testing was done with low ride thin athletic socks. -

Got these for my son to wear while he trains on his ERG. He wears a size 12 and size 12 fit him perfectly. He likes how they are lightweight and flexible but still comfortable. He really gets a sweat going when he is training and says that these shoes breathe well. We'll see how they last. He flexes them quite a bite while rowing.  If anything changes, I will update the review.

评论概述: Not Bad, compared to the other 2 I Got
评论详情: these were a pair bought along with 2 others and probably is the best out of them, The other 2 came damaged and were poorly constructed but were from the same company WHITTIN. These compared to the Whittin trail minimalist toe box gym shoes and the whittin minimalist fashion sneakers these had the least amount of room in the toe area although they are still pretty wide in the front, they fit much better around the bridge of the foot then the other 2 where those were choking and way too small these were actually comfortable, inspecting the shoes the same way I did the other 2 I did not see the same issues (damage and loose stitching)  Pro: cheap decent construction comfortable enough  Con: not as wide in the toe area as there other 2 products that were tried with and needed plastic on the lacing area extends too far forward and will sometimes put too much pressure on the the joint around the pinky toe

I normally wear a size 13 however I thought I’d order the 12 1/2 ( did not offer 13) and because they’re wider in the toe area they fit perfect !!  I really love the quality and the look . I’m surprised how comfortable they feel well padded, however not thick…. I’ll use them in the gym and see how they hold up. I might even order another color I like these so much …..Michael , Coos Bay, Oregon. 👌😘

评论概述: Great shoes, takes some time to get used to.
评论详情: My first time using zero drop shoes. It's definitely a different experience and feeling than wearing other shoes. Used them for running and it's like running barefooted. I can actually feel the ground. My calves were burning after a run, but it felt good like they we're actually being used like they're supposed to. My feet also felt better after the run compared to using other running shoes. I didn't get blisters after running 5 miles. Felt more natural with my feet striking the ground instead of being supported by memory foam. These shoes are like wearing socks with a sole at the bottom. Definitely worth a try and for the price it's a steal. I wear a size 10 U.S, so I got the size 43. It fit perfectly snug, so if you want a little more room in the front of your toes I suggest going a size up, but if you want a snug fit buy the exact size. The material is stretchy, so even if it fits tight it will stretch. It does feel a bit tight in the beginning, but after the run I didn't even notice.  Edit: So I ripped one of the top shoe lace loop holes. This was my mistake as I pulled hard to get the shoe really tight, but in the process the rubber ripped. Just putting this note here to let others know to not pull too hard or you can rip the rubber with the shoe lace. All in all still a great shoe. I'm going to fix it with some super glue.

评论概述: Good barefoot choice, but toe box is narrow.
评论详情: I like the construction on these a lot so far. I live in Hawaii, so I prefer my feet to be able to breathe. These really allow that due to the mesh design, and so they stay comfortable where other shoes I use are not. I often wear a size 44 but I've been getting 43 lately, as I did with these, and it fits great with little to no excess toe room (which I like because it makes the shoe feel snug and form fitted). I'd say they are true to size. The sole has a bit more rubber than my typical preference but again in Hawaii this is nice because I spend a lot of time on lava rocks which absolutely demolishes barefoot shoes. My only complaint is that the toe box is narrow. My feet, despite wearing barefoot for nearly a decade, remain rather narrow. So this works for me. But if you have wide feet or your toes have a healthy spread, these are going to be too narrow for you. Check the measurements and consider how you like shoes to fit. These will feel good, comfortable and breathable for most people I think, but if you know you have wider feet or a wider toe spread, just know that you're pushing it with these shoes. That being said, I would totally buy them again and recommend them.

评论概述: Great for back, but beware goat heads and shin pain
评论详情: If you're getting a zero drop sole shoe, then these are great. The fabric is a bit elastic which helps make the shoes feel comfortable immediately out of the box. I paired them with some elastic shoe laces and they make a great slip on. They are quiet, fit right but offer no arch support. Simple warnings if you have never had barefoot shoes, the lack of cushion is, at first, very hard on your shins. You will go around a month with shin pain as your body adapts to the change. The pain is never unbearable, but it's a bone pain which is definitely unpleasant. Due to this, don't give up. The temporary shin pain is worth the eventually lack of back pain and strain. While not a perfect solution to lower back pains, the benefits of barefoot shoes and zero drop soles are very real ib my experience and have relieved years of back pain. The next part, specific to this shoe is that the sole is thin. This is intentional but something you may not realize is that it is just thin enough for longer goat heads to penetrate the sole and prick your foot. This came as a shock to me the first time I got soles these thin. If you live in an area where goat heads grow then you may want to look into some sort of sole insert that is puncture resistant. Many are sold for construction workers for protection and they are around $15-35. You are easily able to remove the included insole and replace it and I'd recommend it if you may find yourself walking in goat heads or other such spikes. While you may debate whether or not you should try barefoot shoes and zero drop soles, if you find yourself wanting to try them out then I'd recommend these ones. Good for work, good for walking and worth the money.

I’ve owned these now for 2-1/2 years. Worn roughly 4-6 days a week in that time period while at the gym. Shoes were great but I would not recommend for running. Not enough padding as I ran with my son for a fun raiser. The comfort was great seemed durably but the final straw to have to retire these were the outside rubber piece broke (the part that holds the laces) not sure from over use or what. I would buy these again but want something with a bit more absorbing power for when I run.

Been wearing these several weeks. They are perfect for the Florida heat. They breathe well. The sole is very comfortable and there are no stress tears anywhere. Wearing these on rocky ground would not be recommended  as you would definitely feel the rocks. They grip very well.  I am happy with them.

评论概述: Whitin's Size Recommendation is Correct (for me)
评论详情: My dress shoe is a 10.5C.  I have bought running shoes for the last 40 years that were 11.5 - using thick Thorlo socks.  Whitin recommended moving up a half size.  Whitin's 11 (44) is just right.  I bought them as an inexpensive introduction to barefoot shoes.  So far, they are durable enough.  Most of my use has been on a treadmill.  I intend to use them on streets over the next few months and see how they fare vs. traditional running shoes (mine are mostly Mizuno or Asics - although I have bought other brands).  I ditch running shoes at 300 miles.
Market is that its wide but even with me going up 2 sizes its still not wide enough.  Otherwise fairly comfortable
The heel is very comfortable, but the toebox is very narrow and crunches my toes. Definitely not a "barefoot" shoe.
Great value for price.
These shoes have been a nightmare and have caused so much pain on my joints. Do not buy them, could not recommend less

评论概述: Top lace loop ripped out after less than a month
评论详情: Top lace loops ripped out less than a month into owning them. Seem like decent shoes besides the weak lace loops though.

I bought these for my cardio rehab as 2 instructors were wearing them. Figured that would be good enough for me. They are just fine for that and don’t look bad when I wear them to work. The wide toe box is great. I just ordered another pair for my son!
I waited too long to try them and now I can’t return them.. they slip off when doing lunges:(.. they have a part that some how pulls up on my toenail and it hurts.
I was sceptical, but they are awesome

I wouldn’t say I have super wide feet, but I wear a size 14. I thought the shoes would be good but they were absolutely terrible no support whatsoever and the side soul only went to the middle of my foot so extremely narrow shoes.
Lo recomiendo muy suaves.
Son comodisimos. Material elástico muy confortable.
Honestly I bought them because they are black without a logo.

评论概述: Solid yet inexpensive light Breathable running shoe with barefoot sole
评论详情: Running in overly padded running shoes is no good. This barefoot sole running shoe holds up incredibly well to daily street running. At $40 compared to it's $150 counterpart - vivobarefoot, there is not enough of a difference to to make the extra $110 for the vivobarefoot worth it. The wide toe box and and 5mm foot bed are all you need and very comfortable. There is even enough room to add arch inserts if you suffer from plantar fasciitis.
Wear with either long socks or no-show, and you’re golden. Good shoes that are a nice style for the gym and outdoor stuff

The price to get these is phenomenal. Overall I I’ve had a lot of barefoot shoes even Vibram toe shoes but they kept ripping after a year or so. I do a decent amount of outdoor running. I got these to try out and while the price is good they start to fall apart after about 3 months of running ont hem about 10 miles a week or so. You can tell the quality is very mediocre but you can’t really beat the cost. You can already see the sole starting to detach from the shoe and the inside or whatever that’s called just crumbles up inside once you run on them a few times. I ended up just taking it out. I wouldn’t buy them again
Toe box is too narrow for human feet

评论概述: I'd give it 5 stars if it weren't for...
评论详情: The durability on this shoe isn't too great. I have been using the same pair of shoes for almost every day use for 2+ years straight. So here is what I will summarize to keep the journey concise:  The Cons: - The insole fell out and wore out within the first 6 months if I remember correctly. Eventually I just pulled it out and went on like that. - The tread on the shoes also wore out very quickly, with most of it gone also within the first year or 6 months. I used these shoes for playing soccer, and also going to work everyday where I stood on a concrete smooth ground. - The tread now is like paper thin and I am honestly surprised I don't have any holes officially showing. - Don't step in any puddles with these shoes, they get wet easily! Good thing is they can also dry kind of fast, but overall not comfortable getting wet with.  Pros: - Its a barefoot shoe so expect a barefoot experience (which I am a fan of now because I have wide flat feet) - These shoes are SUPER comfortable when you first put them on and have great traction! - I love the elastic all around that feels like a nice hug on my feet all the time without limiting my movement in anyway. - No pinching ever noticed with these shoes they are great for parkour too if you are into that.  Overall: I think its worth the price considering how I abused these shoes for 2 years. However I would love to see some durability improvements to really make this good to recommend to friends. They need a better sole compound overall that will help it last longer.  Hope this helps.
Es como si estuviera sin calzado. Excelente producto y lo mejor su comodidad.
Cheap materials
I love these shoes, but only wore them for casual wear, not for running. Great snug but not pinching fit, look good, and a very acceptable price.
Small

评论概述: Thin-ish sole to feel the ground, which is the fun part.
评论详情: They look normal enough versus some goofy looking barefoot shoes. The DO have some traction tread.
For the price the quality is excellent and I love the barefoot feeling! Will purchase again. The shoes are very comfortable and stylish!

Soles of shoes came pinkish orange rather than advertised neutral gum color. These might look good on Halloween night but not every day use 😂 Wife purchased same type/color in women’s and you can clearly see the difference. I noticed other reviews saying the same thing and am wondering if a bad manufacturing batch came through causing the discoloration. Returning and will try a different model.
No dislikes, very lightweight and comfortable for gym workouts. very satisfied, thanks!
they’re like a sock with a sole…which is fine but the sole is way too narrow and not shaped naturally.
I wear these as my gym shoes and they have been great. They are comfortable, flexible, breathe well, and have held up. I’ll get another pair after I’ve worn these out.

You may need to size up a bit more than recommended. I wear an 11.5 in most shoes and so I ordered a 12 but my toes were cramped when I tried these on. They also arrived dingy with dark smudges and what looks like pet hair all over them. Some loose stitching and the small size are why I’m returning these.

评论概述: Fit is great, but one caveat
评论详情: I wear a size 14, and it is very difficult to find one that actually fits. These fit incredibly well, and leave room for my toes without getting crowded. They are also very comfortable. That said, these are good for walking or running on flat terrain. Do not try wearing these if you are hiking or walking over rocks or textured areas. Your foot will fill every little detail, and you will be suffering later. I brought these camping, and could only wear them for a few hours. However, since I’ve gotten back, I’ve worn them all the time. There’s a time and a place. I would definitely recommend. Just proceeded with caution.
A nice, far less expensive alternative to Vivo Barefoot.  I have received many compliments.

I’ve owned these shoes for the past 60 days, and for the price, they offer excellent value. The comfort level is impressive, and they have held up well through regular wear and even a few trips through the washing machine. If you’re new to bare foot shoes, be aware that they take a bit of adjustment, as you can feel the surface beneath you with each step. The sole is thinner than you're typical shoe, they’re great for everyday walking on level surfaces. However, if you’re planning on walking over rocks, stones, or rougher terrain, be prepared for a bit more impact on your feet due to the thinner sole. While I can’t compare them directly to other barefoot shoes, the sole thickness is definitely something to keep in mind. Overall, for the price and quality, I’d rate these shoes a solid 10 out of 10.
I wear a 11 these wash 11 but they fit to snug so if you order a 11 better get an 12

评论概述: Fell apart after 2 work outs and one walk
评论详情: I spent money I barely have to replace shoes I desperately needed only for them to fall apart in less than a week. I understand we live in an age where companies love to make inferior products so you’re obligated to replace what you’ve purchased, but this is the worst I’ve ever seen. If you’re thinking about going cheaper with your barefoot shoes, go somewhere else.

These are the most comfortable runners I have ever had. I wear them daily as an everyday sneaker. In a recent trip to Canada I wore these through airport security and on the plane OMG so much better that traditional Nikes or Under Armor. I feel like my feet can "breathe" more and its almost like I'm just wearing great  comfy socks with support. Again SO comfortable. Great product

The shoes are great! But... I have just worn a hole through the sole of my 3rd pair in under 2 years.  The first pair lasted roughly a year. The second pair 6 months. The most recent pair less than 5 months. Note: I was wearing them all day every day under normal conditions. Not running miles and miles, or being rough on them.  I really love these shoes and would continue buying them if they would last at least a year. I understand that you can only expect so much out of a $40 pair of shoes, and that you get what you pay for. But lasting less than 6 months is unacceptable and the normal price has gone up nearly 10 dollars in 2 years, so I can no longer justify the purchase.
They don't fit my feet well, too much slippage at the heel. Otherwise I loved them.
Very comfortable. Highly recommended. Would probably get another pair so they don’t get worn out too fast.

评论概述: Great shoes - plus up to 1/2 size larger when ordering
评论详情: My new favorite sneakers.  Very comfortable and light weight.  I’m a true size 13 and ordered the 13 1/2 and fit perfect.  Also order 12 1/2 but too small.  Not a 5 star only because when they are packaged they come air sealed and shrink wrapped.  After opening sneakers have a large folded crease down the middle that’s difficult to smooth and get out.  Even after steaming.  But will order another pair soon.
Incredible shoes! I get so many compliments and they're incredible durable for barefoot shoes

The only thing I have to complain about these are the insoles. For the first few months the were great. The insoles started to slip up towards the back. I still wear these shoes alot, I would purchase again. Might just need to get new insoles.
premium shoes for lifting sessions; comfortable and no socks requiered!
Good shoe and cheap but wears iout to fast. I wore out a pair in 3 weeks walking 5 miles/day.
These shoes only lasted 4 months before there was a hole in both of the rubber bottoms.
Don't know how these will wear over time yet, but they are very affordable and comfortable. They look great and I can feel the change(for the better !) in my posture and my gait . Barefootin'. Nice.
highly recommend these. They are fantastic.

评论概述: Garbage that broke within a year
评论详情: I received these as a gift in the summer of 23, after owning Xero/Merrell barefoot shoes since 2020. While whitin looks far more casual, the build quality is significantly worse, and these have been the only shoes to fail at walking on anything more than concrete. The internal adhesives for the cheap foam insert disintegrated, and the soles fail to protect from even small spiky dandelions (sowthistle) you encounter on the sidewalk. I received this as a loving gift and I despise them, my first pair of vapor glove 3s have spent thousands of more hours on my feet and have held up far more, these whitins are the worst barefoot shoes I own. I've bought a pair of vaporgloves on sale as a replacement that look casual enough to impress the misses, and hopefully they won't fail as blatantly as these into 2025.
I love these shoes; they are comfortable to the max. I wear them practically everyday.
Why did you decide to shove an unnecessary arch support in a barefoot shoe? These shoes are unwearable.
Got lots of compliments. Also the hear shows are very comfortable and have a high arch. Easy to walk in and grip the ground just like going foot.

评论概述: Great minimal shoe for the price!
评论详情: Took it on some trail hikes and it’s what I was looking for. Durable sole with way better traction than my locals slippers. Good for running and hiking for people who don’t think they have sensitive feet!
Estoy muy feliz con la compra aún que siguiendo la recomendación de talla me quedan un poco grandes, igual los conservé y los uso a diario.

This is my first pair of this type of shoe. I wear them all the time! One thing I wish the shoe had was a wider toe box. They seem just like every other shoe on the market in this sense. If you are seeking a wide toe box, maybe look somewhere else. If you are looking for something that is comfy and gives you that barefoot feel, then these are perfect.

I had previously bought a pair of these shoes exact size and color and they fit great. Apparently Whitin has changed the shoe because they now have a more narrow toe box, not what I wanted. I am used to the wide toe box of their old design, this pair will be sent back.
I ordered these for our employee and they have already come undone at the sole. Terrible shoe. Don’t waste your money.

Pros: The first lasted a year with almost daily wear, some significant heavy duty wear. They were great wide toe box shoes, and the fit was perfect. They took some getting used to because you still feel rocks and things due to a thin sole, but mostly that’s fine. On occasion it can be a little pokey. They are SUPER slippery on wet rocks or tile, in the grocery store even.  Now for some reason the color of the rubber on the bottom this time is almost pink instead of tan. (I have the black and “gum” color) They are definitely much less sleek with that pinkish tint  In my pictures you can see my first shoe (granted, worn and dirty) is more tan (especially on the side where it’s more original color) rather than the new shoes which are reddish pink?  The wide toe box is basically non existent on the new pair. It really rubbed on my pinky toe. There should not be a period of “breaking them in” with wide toe box shoes— so I’m sending them back. In my picture you can see my old shoe on the right is much wider. Thats how they should be. Overall— disappointing because they were shoes I would have bought over and over again until the design changes.
Use them for running on grass and dirt, also in bodycombat and yoga classes

These are the only pair of gym shoes I use anymore. The thin, flexible, zero-drop soles provide the best stability and grip I’ve found in any shoe I’ve tried. The mesh uppers are super flexible and lightweight and air/dry out quickly. It’s as close to being barefoot as you can get while also getting the protection and grip needed to reduce your risk of injury. As I’m often between sizes (11.5-12 US), I went a size down on these (11), and they fit great. I’ve worn them minimum 2-3 x a week for about 6 months, and they still look practically brand new. When they do wear out, I definitely plan to replace them with a new pair just like them.
